Description: Ostracon, small fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394504) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394504)
